BriefBoxes.title: Overview
BriefBoxes.description: Snakewall is a modern twist on the classic Snake game, re-imagined as a dynamic Live Wallpaper. Built for Android, it features smooth animations, adaptive design, and minimalist visuals.

BriefBoxes.title: Technical
BriefBoxes.description:
- Tech Stack: Java, Android Studio.

- Platform: Android Live Wallpaper Engine.

- Rendering: Canvas API (hardware-accelerated).

- Grid System: Odd-number square grid (dynamic size).

- Modular: Code is written modular and highly scalable ensuring best coding practices.

- Snake Structure: Linked list of grid coordinates.

- Screen Handling: Responsive to resolution & orientation.

- Persistence: Game state saved/restored on wallpaper pause/resume.

- Performance: Optimized for minimal battery usage.

- Update Cycle: Runs on a low-interval frame loop.

- Input using touch detection in wallpaper engine.

- Customizable: Color themes and Grid visibility options.

- Sleek UI.

BriefBoxes.title: The Challenge
BriefBoxes.description:
The initial idea was to mimic Nothing's Snake Game Widget, I created a custom view for game with gesture support. However, when i tried to implement it as a widget, i hit a roadblock with the widget's limitations.

I posted about this on my telegram channel and got a suggestion to implement it as a live wallpaper instead. This was a game-changer, allowing me to use the Android Live Wallpaper Engine and canvas API for smooth animations and adaptive design.

However one limitation came as i could not use gestures as it will trigger system gestures like app drawer or notification panel, for which i adapted to buttons on screen.
